title: Liliana Ventricelli
text:
Liliana Ventricelli (born 12 January 1986 under her real name Cecilia Ventricelli) is an Italian politician. She was elected as deputy of the <a href="Italian%20parliament">Italian parliament</a> and she became deputy on 15 March 2013 under Italian <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28Italy%29">Democratic Party</a>.
Biography.
Liliana Ventricelli was born in Altamura on 12 January 1986. After graduating from the <a href="classical%20lyceum">classical lyceum</a> "<a href="Luca%20de%20Samuele%20Cagnazzi">Luca de Samuele Cagnazzi</a>" of her hometown <a href="Altamura">Altamura</a>, she enrolled in the faculty of <a href="law">law</a> of the <a href="University%20of%20Bari">University of Bari</a>. After her experience as an institute representative in high school, she becomes interested in politics.
In 2008 she starts to become involved in one of Italy's most prominent parties - the <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28Italy%29">Democratic Party</a>. In 2009 she becomes secretary of the circle "Giovani Democratici" in Altamura. In 2010, she officially joined Italian <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28Italy%29">Democratic Party</a>.
She supported important campaigns in her hometown - <a href="Altamura">Altamura</a> - such as the campaign on the <a href="referendum">referendum</a> against the privatization of Italian water supply companies and against nuclear power. In February 2013, at the age of 27, she was elected as a deputy of <a href="Italian%20Parliament">Italian Parliament</a> and she remained deputy until the end of the term in March 2018.
